#Text=Halberstadt
#Text=A town in the northern foothills of the Harz Mountains of central Germany , Halberstadt is known as The Gateway to the Harz Mountains and retains many important historic buildings .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Halberstadt , a town of about 50,000 people , is only a few minutes by car from the mountains and travellers are welcomed from afar by the impressive towers of the 1200-year old Bishop`s Seat .
#Text=The town was severely damaged in World War II , but retains many important historic buildings and much of its ancient townscape .
#Text=Notable places in Halberstadt include the Liebfrauenkirche and St. Stephen Cathedral , churches built in the 12th and 13th centuries , respectively .
#Text=Halberstadt is the site of the first documented large , permanent pipe organ installation in 1361 .
#Text=The cathedral is notable among those in northern European towns in having retained its medieval treasury in virtually complete condition .
#Text=Among its treasures are the oldest surviving tapestries in Europe , dating from the 12th century .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The closest airports with international flights are Leipzig/Halle ( LEJ ) near Schkeuditz and Hanover Airport ( HAJ )
#Text=both airports are connected to their respective towns by S-Bahn and from there you can take regional trains to Halberstadt ; for Hanover change in Goslar and for Leipzig/Halle change in Halle .
#Text=Leipzig Halle Airport is also served by some long distance trains , enabling a change in Magdeburg
#Text=By train
#Text=There are frequent daily direct connections to Magdeburg approximately 40 minutes , Halle approximately 1 hour 30 minutes and Hanover approximately 2 hours .
#Text=Trains can be booked via the DB website .
#Text=By road
#Text=Halberstadt is served by both the B79 and the B81 which provide access from all directions and lead to the main regional road B6 to the south .
#Text=The B6 in turn , leads north west to the A395 and Braunschweig , or east to the A14 which goes north towards Magdeburg or south to Halle and Leipzig .
#Text=By tram
#Text=Halberstadt has around 9.5km of tram track which form two tram routes around town .
#Text=These trams can be accessed from any one of around 30 tram stops and used to travel around the area for a small charge .
#Text=Timetables .
#Text=TIP : The www . insa . de HarzTourCard enables you to travel by bus , train and narrow gauge train ( only Schierke – Brocken ) as much as you like within three days .
#Text=It costs € 18 , family : € 34,50 from the local tourist information or website .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Halberstadt has 5 bus routes which cover the whole area and are available for use by visitors and locals alike for a small charge .
#Text=Timetable and prices also at the above website .
#Text=By historical tram
#Text=Historische Straßenbahnen , Hinter dem Rathause 6 , ☏ +493941551815 , fax : +493941551089 .
#Text=A 1939 Tram with 40 seats can be booked for a 1 hour tour of the town for € 129 .
#Text=This must be pre booked on the website .
#Text=Museums
#Text=Berend Lehmann Museum , Bakenstraße 57 , ☏ +493941583238 .

#Text=Tu - Th 12:00 - 18:00 , F - Sa 12:00 - 22:00 , Su 12:00-17:00. Established in 2001 , on the 300th Anniversary of the Prussian state , this museum is concerned with German-Jewish history and in particular the difficult periods of Prussian-Jewish history .
#Text=There is also a café on site for refreshments .
#Text=Gleimhaus Halberstad , Domplatz 31 , ☏ +49394168710 .
#Text=May-Oct Tu - F 09:00 - 17:00 , Nov-Apr 09:00 - 16:00 , All year Sa - Su 10:00-16:00.
#Text=This Literature Museum displays the collection put together in 1862 by the poet " Johan Ludwig Wilhelm Gleim " and is a must for fans of German Poetry and Literature € 3 .
#Text=DDR Museum , Karl-Liebknecht-Straße 1 , ☏ +4930847123731 .

#Text=Su – F 10:00 - 20:00 , Sa 10:00-22:00. Not technically part of Museum Island , but immediately adjacent , the hands-on DDR Museum , gives an upbeat look at daily life in the GDR – achieved partly by glossing over gloomy issues like censorship and repression .
#Text=€ 6 or € 4 .
#Text=Places of Worship
#Text=Der Halberstädter Dom St. Stephanus und St. Sixtus .
#Text=The cathedral was built 1236-1491 and is considered a jewel of Gothic architecture .
#Text=The two mighty towers typify renaissance and baroque building skills .
#Text=It had 2 predecessors : one was the 859 Carolingian structure and the other , the 922 Otto creation .
#Text=The 600 Artefacts and treasures in the cathedral 's collection make up the largest and most important collection of art from the middle ages in any German church .
#Text=It was severely damaged in 1945 and was restored by Halberstadt architect Walter Bolze .
#Text=€ 8 .
#Text=St. Burchardi church ( Sankt-Burchardi-Kirche ) , Am Kloster 1 .
#Text=This little church has been playing a John Cage piece called Organ²/ASLSP ( A s SL ow a S P ossible ) since 5 Sep 2001 .

#Text=The note played changes , on average , only once a year and is reckoned to be both the slowest and longest duration performance in the world since the concert is scheduled to end on 5 Sep 2640 .
#Text=The next date when something " exciting " happens will be 5 Sep 2020 .
#Text=Places of Interest
#Text=Cave dwellings of langenstein , Langenstein , at the southern rim of the Harz .
#Text=No Restrictions .
#Text=Occupied as dwellings until 1916
#Text=these dwellings are unique within Germany .
#Text=( Bring a torch )
#Text=Free .
#Text=Giant Wine Barrel , In den Spiegelsbergen 6 , ☏ +493941583995 .
#Text=Open daily from 11:00 clock Monday - Closed .
#Text=Located in Jagdschloss is Halberstadts entry in the Guinness book of records , namely the oldest and largest wine barrel in the world .
#Text=Holding 140,000 litres it was built 400 years ago by Michael Werner from Landau , and was entered in the Guinness book of records on 6 June 2008 .
#Text=The barrel can be accessed via the Spiegelsberge Jagdschloss restaurant which opens daily from 1100 hrs
#Text=Do
#Text=Nordharzer Stadtebundtheater , Spiegelstr . 20a , ☏ +493941696549 .
#Text=As Per Theatre Guide .
#Text=For visitors who wish to experience German Theatre .
#Text=There are details on the website of a frequent and varied programme of productions and tickets can also be ordered on the website or purchased directly in the theatre As Per Theatre Guide .
#Text=Sport and Freizeitzentrum , Gebrüder-Rehse-Str . 12 , ☏ +49394168780 .
#Text=The many facilities have different timings , the website gives a full list .
#Text=Halberstadt has a large sports centre which consists of a sports and fitness area , a comprehensive water park , and a large wellness and beauty centre .
#Text=Sports includes squash , tennis , badminton and a climbing wall as well as a comprehensive keep fit and weight training area .

#Text=Sealand has 4700 square metres of water park facilities such as pools and slides etc. Sauna land offers a range of sauna experiences and beautyland completes the set with wellness facilities on offer
#Text=Tiergarten Halberstadt , Spiegelsberge 4 , ☏ +49394124132 .
#Text=May - Sept. Mo - So 9 - 19hrs
#Text=Oct. - Apr
#Text=Mo - So 9 - 17 hrs.
#Text=A Family friendly park which will provide a few hours entertainment for children and animal lovers .
#Text=Open all year round , its occupants include camels , raccoons , wolves , dingos , lynxes as well as domestic animals and an area where visitors can touch the tame animals and feed them .
#Text=There is also an amusing animal school show for visitors
